
{{alias}}( ...fcn )
    Function sequence.

    Only the leftmost function is explicitly permitted to accept multiple
    arguments. All other functions are evaluated as unary functions.

    Notes:

    - The function will throw if provided fewer than two input arguments.
    - The difference between this function and {{alias:@stdlib/utils/compose}}
      is that this function evaluates input arguments from left-to-right, rather
      than right-to-left.

    Parameters
    ----------
    fcn: ...Function
        Functions to evaluate in sequential order.

    Returns
    -------
    out: Function
        Pipeline function.

    Examples
    --------
    > function a( x ) { return 2 * x; }
    > function b( x ) { return x + 3; }
    > function c( x ) { return x / 5; }
    > var f = {{alias}}( a, b, c );
    > var z = f( 6 )
    3

    See Also
    --------
